bibl.title: Letter from Landon Reed to Blossom Reed, [September 1929]

div1.p: Landon Reed writes to Blossom Reed about the family cats.

div1.head: Letter from Landon Reed to Blossom Reed, [September 1929].
div1.p:
Junior (Doc Crates) who was
Mimmies developed a huge
lump on his shoulder so he
took him to the hospital
& the Dr. said it was an abscess
& to lean him there as they
would have to treat it - so
after he had been there several
days Maury swelled up like
a mountain & had a fir so
we took him there & then
got hard hearted where on re-
membered he was a she
& told Capt. Mallece to chloropene
is as long as is was deck-
Then we came home-
That left Charlie Royce or “Too-
sweet” As he is called who
we will have to keep as in to the
went al ratle kitten I have
ever seen- Two days ago
they called up to say
Junio had died that the
abscess would not heal &
blood poisoning has set in
she had died but they said
“the other Mur Ketten is all right”!
& they had never chloropene
Maury & he had gotten entirely
well so there we simply could
not have him killed so he
has returned home to his
mother & sister - now considering
we have to keep Too Sweet
because her fur is like a
Persians & her face is so round
& short just what would you
suggest about Maury? I got
Billy a good house- Doc died - For
sweet is ours & Maury is up to you!
